Science Surveyor Goes Rorschach

16 Oct 2014

In the famous "garage" room of the new Brown Institute space, we had our second big lit. review hackathon, during which our team went a little Rorschach... This image is taken from the article: Mapping the backbone of science by Kevin W. Boyack, Richard Klavans and Katy Borner, which, amongst other things evaluated their science maps based on "two different accuracy measures, the scalability of the similarity algorithm, and the readability of layouts (clustering)." It seems like aesthetics determined the final choice of model...
